value.title: As Waymo resumes self-driving tests, backup drivers are still worried about the virus
value.excerpt: Waymo is planning to resume testing its autonomous vehicles in Arizona on May 11th, nearly two months after pausing its robotaxi service as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. But some of the company’s backup drivers are worried that Waymo may be rushing back into service too quickly.

value.title: Artificial intelligence is energy-hungry. New hardware could curb its appetite.
value.excerpt: To just solve a puzzle or play a game, artificial intelligence can require software running on thousands of computers. That could be the energy that three nuclear plants produce in one hour. A team of engineers has created hardware that can learn skills using a type of AI that currently runs on software platforms.
